newsitem.title: USA: PriCellular, BellSouth in license swap deal.
newsitem.headline: PriCellular, BellSouth in license swap deal.

text.p: PriCellular Corp said on Wednesday it agreed to swap two Alabama wireless licenses for one owned by BellSouth Corp in Wisconsin and $18 million in cash, subject to Federal Communications Commission approval.

PriCellular is swapping a license covering Florence, Ala., with a population of 137,000, and an adjacent rural license with a population of 62,000, and will gain a rural Wisconsin license with a population of 118,000.

BellSouth's payment will make up for the difference in population (pops) of the swapped territories, it said. Once the deal goes through PriCellular will have 4.1 million pops in total. -- Nick Louth, New York Newsroom 212 859 1712
